definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: Open Source "Social App Server" Might Crack Garden Walls?
sentences.chinese: 开源“社交应用服务器”有可能推倒那些“院墙”？

sentences.english: The government plan to pull down the building and rebuild it.
sentences.chinese: 政府计划推倒那幢楼重建一座。

sentences.english: Sun, the Lehman Brothers economist, says as manufacturers are pushed to the brink, China's stock markets could see sharp declines.
sentences.chinese: 孙明春表示，制造商被推倒悬崖边缘，中国股市大跌。

sentences.english: Product such as beg baifeng let I went to the hospital to see the Yin was baifeng down on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 品如求白凤让本人去医院看世贤，被白凤推倒在地上。

sentences.english: You see centaurs running to the trading post, knocking the walls down, burning and killing the merchants.
sentences.chinese: 你会看到半人马跑向交易所，推倒墙壁，烧杀商人。

sentences.english: The old lady was flung out of the house because the owner wanted to pull it down.
sentences.chinese: 老太太被赶出了房子，因为房东要推倒房子。

sentences.english: A woman pushes a stroller down the sidewalk in front of us.
sentences.chinese: 我们前面的一位妇女将一名流浪汉推倒在人行道上。

sentences.english: Lucy pushes Kim, and the officer breaks up the tussle.
sentences.chinese: 露西推倒了金姆，警员拉开打架的各方。

sentences.english: Qiuhua accidentally bumps into Jiazhen causing her to miscarriage.
sentences.chinese: 秋桦意外推倒佳珍，导致佳珍流产并昏迷不醒。

sentences.english: Foredeck plates pulled down against camber of deck beams.
In the end it was the unity and spirit of these same people that led to his downfall.
sentences.chinese: 最终导致人们团结一致，万众一心将他推倒。

sentences.english: You have put an end to his splendor and cast his throne to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 你使他的光辉止息，将他的宝座推倒于地。

sentences.english: Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 你使他的光辉止息，将他的宝座推倒于地。

sentences.english: But at some point, the bad weather you face could knock your house down.
sentences.chinese: 但是某个时候，你面临的糟糕天气会把你的房子推倒。

sentences.english: Someone who demolishes or dismantles buildings as a job.
sentences.chinese: 把推倒或拆除建筑物当作工作的人。

sentences.english: Pan and her husband were seized and their house was pulled down.
sentences.chinese: 潘蓉和丈夫被扣押，他们的房子也被推倒。

definition: to force oneself upon sb (idiom)/to rape
(hitting) squarely in the middle/(slicing) across the middle/to hold by the waist
to pull down/(coll.) to let it go/to drop it
